replies: ["I think you may be right , Dawkins is a better wordsmith than he is a psychologist . His 'people skills ' suck . Having said that , I 'm not sure that he actually does think that Jesus was particularly intelligent . The title of the video is cliick-bail conjured-up by a Guardian editor who pinched the first half of a sentence Dawkins uttered 13 minutes into the podcast of the full interview ( it does not appear in this video ) . The full sentence ends with : _ '' had he known what we know today . `` _ He was linking belief with 'knowledge ' rather than 'intelligence ' . Why would you continue to belief in Thor 's and his hammer when you have learned the true cause of thunder ? Dawkins only suggests that Jesus was *_sufficiently_* intelligent to recognize the ramifications of modern scientific understanding of cosmogony , abiogenesis , evolution , germ-theory , geology , etc . I have heard Dawkins suggest elsewhere that Jesus ( as portrayed in the gospels ) would have to be reasonably intelligent to be regarded as a 'great moral teacher ' , who could hold his own against the priests , and have a bunch of men apparently gave up their livelihoods & families to be bank-rolled by women in order to tour the desert with him preaching _'Repent , the End is Nigh . ' _ Personally , I think charisma is all he 'd have needed . As for the historicity of Jesus , again you may be right , but he 's careful not to suggest that he thinks Jesus was , in any way , divine . It would be foolish to assert that there were no such charismatics on whom to build a legend , and probably one of them was called Yeshua ( or whatever ) but , like you , I think Dawkins 's misplaced attempt to find common ground , is a lost opportunity to highlight the fact that the total lack of evidence for Jesus ' existence allows for some historians to make a convincing argument that Jesus was completely mythical ( even if he 's not one of them . )", "+Leonard Ronald Dow . I appreciate what he ( Dawkins ) thinks he 's trying to do , it 's all about Supremacy of Interpretation . But what is the provenance , for example , of his claim that `` Somebody as intelligent as Jesus would have been an atheist '' ? I can find nothing in the alleged sayings of Jesus that would suggest that he was intelligent , and certainly nothing that would indicate he had atheist tendencies . All the pronouncements of the gospel Jesus are eschatological or doctrinal , bereft of any hint of philosophical thought . Jesus is usually portrayed as answering Dorothy Dixers put to him by his disciples , along the lines of `` how great art thou , O lord ? '' . Dawkin 's game plan is to sound reasonable . By suggesting that Jesus was `` intelligent '' , he 's hoping the believer will think `` Well , Dawkins might be an atheist , but at least he recognises that Jesus was smart '' . Thereby Dawkins thinks that he might have a foot in the door of the minds of the faithful , but I maintain that by suggesting that Jesus was ( a ) historical , and ( b ) clever , he has helped _bolt_ the door of the believer 's mind against any prospective intrusion by the spirit of reason and enlightenment . .", "I agree but I think Dawkins likes to be provocative . I get the impression that he tries to re-appropriate words & phrases that have been 'commandeered ' by religious communities . In the same way , he 'll happily refer to the universe and all that 's in it as 'all creation ' . Now , as the etymological root of the verb _'to create ' _ originally meant _'to grow ' _ ( as can be seen in 'crescendo ' , 'accretion ' and 'crescent ' ) , it is actually more appropriate than using it to mean _'to bring into existence by magic ' _ ( not even the Romans used the word for that purpose when talking about the actions of their gods ) and yet this is another term that seems to have a very specific meaning to 'believers ' . You must remember that Dawkins is , almost above all things , a wordsmith - he chooses his words very carefully , he has learned very well that there are plenty who will try to use his own words against him .", "All very interesting stuff . However , Dawkins could remove ambiguity by using , in this case , a word like `` property '' or `` phenomenon '' .", "*Why* The word has long been used to mean _'by what means ' _ or _'what is the cause of ' _ and Dawkins 's use of it is as valid as in the question : _ '' Why is the sky blue ? `` _ Sometimes , looking for 'purpose ' is just not appropriate . Here 's one online definition : *Why* ( adv . ) _ '' Old English hwi , instrumental case ( indicating for what purpose or _*_by what means ) _*_ of_ hwæt _ ( see what ) , from Proto-Germanic adverb_ hwi _ ( source also of Old Saxon hwi , Old Norse hvi ) , from PIE kwi- ( source of Greek pei `` where '' ) , locative of root kwo- , stem of relative and interrogative pronouns . As an interjection of surprise or emphasis , recorded from 1510s . As a noun , _*_ '' cause , _*_ reason '' from c . 1300 . `` _ ( etymonline ) *Gift* *It 's not a 'Who ' it 's a 'What'* - and even that is not an entity . Richard Dawkins speaks British English - the interviewer is British . In British colloquial English the word 'gift ' can apply to anything that you have n't had to pay for : *_Oxford English Dictionary : _* *Gift 1.2 : * *_ '' A very easy task or unmissable opportunity , _*_ eg : that goal was an absolute gift ; The current climate - fear of terrorism - is an absolute gift to anyone trying to introduce a cull of civil rights . `` _ *Gifts with an identifiable giver : * The sun *gives* us light and warmth . Our clothes *give* us protection from the elements . A falling apple *gave* Newton the idea about gravity . A dog will *give* its owner , love & obedience . Hemorrhoids do n't *give* you a pain in the neck . *Gifts with a 'non-thing ' , 'non-what ' or 'non-who ' giver : * The lack of hard evidence for abiogenesis is a *gift* to creationists and priests alike . The conditions near to deep-sea hydrothermal vents *give* minerals an opportunity to begin a series of chemical reactions that we call 'biology ' . Probably , one such reaction , that started billions of years ago , *gave* us 'life ' . An accidental duplication of the SRGAP2 gene in an ape 's brain 2.4mya *gifted* us with intelligence . Belief in gods *gives* you an impediment to clear , rational thinking . Boromir about the 'One Ring ' : _ '' It is a _*_gift . A gift_*_ to the foes of Mordor . Why not use this ring ? `` _ The *gift* Boromir talked of was *not given* by Sauron but by the *series of happenstances* that took the 'One Ring ' from Sauron 's hand and brought it , via Elendil , Deagol , Smeagol , Bilbo & Frodo , to the Council of Elrond at Imladris . The point is , *a giver is not necessary to acquire gifts and even when one is , there is no requirement for it to have intelligence or intent . * *So , to answer your questions : * it was a series of happenstances that brought a collection of atoms and molecules to the same place in space & time - an incident that began the first unstable chemical reaction that we call 'life ' - a cycle of action & reaction that continues to this day . Based on the work by Jack Szostak , the first biochemical reactions may have been between strands of RNA that self-assembled on a template of montmorillonite clay at the bottom of an ocean near to a hydrothermal vent and that had been captured inside a vesicles of lipids self-assembled on the same clay . Large vesicles absorbed small ones and 'feeding ' and 'growth ' began . As large vesicles were broken up by the waves & currents , new ones formed with different shapes & contents , 'genetics ' & 'reproduction ' began . Rejoice at just how marvellous is life ! Dawkins has quite a *gift* for setting traps with words . I guess his words did n't quite turn out to be the *gift* you had hoped they would be ."]
title: richard dawkins: 'somebody as intelligent as jesus would have been an atheist'

replies: ["@ Gicu Doru I 'm sorry to say that it 's very fallacious and irrational to argue with an unsubstantiated premise , that premise being the existence of god . in rational discourse , you need to prove your presuppositions to be true if you will use them to argue with someone . Until you prove the existence of god , and prove the reliability of the Bible , nothing you say using the Bible or god 's supposed existence has any merit . Your whole comment is based on circular reasoning and does n't bring anything of value to the conversation . Your whole comment is a *HUGE ASSERTION* which you can not prove so why should anyone believe what you have written ?", "\u200b @ filmeseverin * I congratulate you for being a medical student , for your big amount of useful knowledge in biology , anatomy ... but you made an unscientific affirmation* - Thank you for the kind words , but I do n't think my studies are worthy of praise , I 'm just doing what I like . As for the latter part of this sentence , you once again *assert* that what I say is unscientific but do not bring even ONE study to prove your claim . Having asked for proof at least 3 times , and with you not delivering , I suggest we just forget about this point since there seems to be very little conversation going on on that particular point . *That is why you have to believe the truth about God/Jesus ( science will always be just what the cups can think to understand the man who made them ) . * - You make a huge leap in logic here . You claim that since science can not know everything ( which you have n't been able to prove whatsoever so far ) then we must believe in god . That 's ludicrous ! Even if you were right and science had major limits as you claim , that does not warrant in any way a belief in a god . That 's an argument from ignorance fallacy and a god of the gaps argument ! You 're saying ( roughly ) `` Science does n't have the answer , therefore God must have done it '' which is logically fallacious ( god of the gaps ) . Not far along you argumentation logic , you also say something like `` No one knows , therefore , god '' ( argument from ignorance '' . Even if you could prove that 100 % of science was false , that still does n't mean believing in God is true . You still have to bring evidence to the table , which has not been done in the 2000+ years of Christianity . And even if you could prove god , which one would that be ? There are tens of thousands of gods that humankind has created , there is no evidence or reason to believe that the Christian one is more likely to exist . As for your heartfelt explanation , it is very interesting and I would n't dream of calling you crazy or delusional or stupid . But this was a subjective experience , so even if you are right and god did come to you ( which no one can prove ) , you can not argue from personal experience and hope to convince someone . My subjective experience is that there is no god , and this is technically a belief that is just as valid as yours since it is based on a subjective life experience . But what makes you think it was the Christian god ? It seems odd to me that these kinds of dreams or visions always correspond to the religion of the land . Atheists in the Muslim world dream of Allah , you are presumably from a Christian country and therefore dreamt of God , Indians dream of Shiva or Ganesh , Ancient Greeks dreamt of Zeus , Romans dreamt of Mars , etc ... It seems that culture always affects these `` visions '' and people more often than not get converted to the religion of the land . What makes you think your experience was true when billions of people throughout history have had the exact same experiences but they attribute it to different gods ? At the end of the day , I have no interest in saying your belief is wrong . I can not prove that it is wrong . But you and I also ca n't prove that it is right , and until we can prove either proposition , the logical and rational position is disbelief ( look up the Null Hypothesis to understand why ) . I am not *against* the concept of a god at all . I think some of these alleged gods are pretty immoral and evil , but others are not . If anyone brings up any evidence for their god I will believe with them . But what kind of God requires faith instead of reason and evidence to believe in him ? Christians always claim God is all knowing and all powerful , which means that if God exists , he knows EXACTLY what kind of evidence would convince me and he knows EXACTLY what to do to make me believe in him . So god has to be one of these 3 things : - Either he is all knowing and all powerful but does n't care enough about me to show me the way to him ( so he is a negligent god , not a good or loving one ) . In this scenario , not my fault if I disbelieve . Also , the kind of god that rewards credulity and faith means he mocks the skepticts and the people that actually think critically about the universe . Why give us a brain if using it makes us skeptical of god claims . - Or he purposely withholds evidence from me because he wants me to go to hell ( which makes him an evil god ) . Once again , he is much more powerful than me if he exists and therefore it is HIS fault not mine that I do n't believe in him . - Or God does n't exist . Whilst this is not at all proven , it is the default position until new evidence is brought to the table . Take your pick ! I do not see any alternatives , but if you have any I 'm happy to hear them . Either way , I do n't know why you waste your time trying to `` spread the word '' when God has this supposed `` plan '' where everything is already all planned out . If god exists , he knew I 'd be an atheist before I was born , and I doubt human preachers are going to poke holes in this supposed `` great God '' .", "Loik Steininger I congratulate you for being a medical student , for your big amount of useful knowledge in biology , anatomy ... but you made an unscientific affirmation : `` after a certain point , things do not get smaller . Or at least they can be considered as a unit and therefore do not need to be analyzed further . '' That is why you have to believe the truth about God/Jesus ( science will always be just what the cups can think to understand the , man who made them ) . You can read below , described in details , how I became a believer : It happened in the first year as a college student . I was an atheist at that time and before , but when I made my girlfriend ( actual wife ) cry , due to a contradictory discussion about God , loving her very much , I ASKED TO GIVE ME A SIGN TO BELIEVE , addressing this from all my soul and from all my heart ( it was like `` God , if you exist , give me a sign to believe in you '' ) , then , in few days , when I had already forgotten about my demand , I had the vision ( please forgive my English , while it is not my native language ) : I was like teleported outdoors in complete dark , feeling the wind blowing slowly , and while worrying where I am , and how could be possible such phenomenon , a sphere of light came slowly from the left ( later I realized that it came from the house in which I was born , the house of my grandfather , who was a priest , being dead at that moment ) , and faster while approaching of me , when I was able to recognize the exact place where I was , due to the reflection of light on the houses on one side and another of the road , being in the middle of the street , quite close to the house where I was born ( in a small village ) . The sphere of light was very bright ( the whitest white ) , diffusing lightly on edges , and in the moment when it touched me , it became like an usual white , decreasing its brightness , as ( like ) it was defiled by me . When that sphere of light was coming , I remembered my demand ( my words : TO GIVE ME A SIGN TO BELIEVE ) , and I realized that I can do nothing to escape from that situation ( I felt that we people are very small and weak , infinitely more than we realize , against what exists beyond us ) . All the time , being inside that light I felt it more like a fluid ( it was not an usual light ) . After few moments , surrounded by that sphere of light ( due to my emotions that have risen dramatically , I was standing up on my toes ) , I felt it going slowly up , tilting my head up , very kindly , by two very gentle hands ( like angelic hands ) , then going very fast into the sky , like a column of light , remaining looking at the dark night sky filled with stars , IN A COMPLETE SILENCE ( that I never experienced ) . I say `` complete silence '' because before that moment it was like in this world , with a permanent almost imperceptible background noise , but then the complete silence made me feel out of this world , like I was dead , and I thought that I will hear some words , but no words and I came very abruptly into our usual reality with my heart beating incredible hard , like outside of my body , and the first thing I said was : `` Thank You for bringing me back ! `` , then I made my first sacrament ( oath ) from my entire life : `` I will tell to all people whom I find not believing in God that GOD EXISTS AND TO THINK MORE ABOUT THIS ! `` .", 'Gicu Doru The is untrue ! replies: ["3 . ( cont 'd ) : Just to be clear , neither trauma nor breeding will affect a geneticist 's ability to trace that individual 's heredity and race based upon the markers associated with such . Sickle cell anemia is virtually entirely exclusive to those of African descent , as it actually increases an individual 's resistance to malaria , a disease mostly seen in that region . A white person 's genes will actually respond differently to certain stimuli such as UV exposure , which makes sense as they primarily evolved in areas with less sunlight . Women experience pain neurologically differently than males and digest/store fat in a different manner , which makes sense in relation to childbirth . As we learn more about genetics we become more and more astute at classifying and identifying those markers that denote expressed characteristics , many of which are ( almost ) exclusively reserved to certain races .", "3 . I do n't know what you 're trying to say here . Are you claiming genetic differences are secondary to epigenetics ( which are merely a distortion of genetics based on extrinsic factors , which presupposes the original genetics ( markers ) ) ? I think you 're referring to the children of the women who were pregnant during the holocaust and as such were predisposed to obesity , and other secondary characteristics , right ? That was an ideal example of epigenetics , which is different in so far as the children of those offspring will not have the same characteristics unless exposed to similar environments , as the actual genes were not altered . I will stand firm here that there absolutely are genetic markers which are indicative of race and sex , going back thousands of years , as there exists volumes upon volumes of research ( past/current ) supporting that claim . 4 . And yet I 'm not talking about collective failure at all , as I do n't see the world that way . Individuals are responsible for their actions , nothing more/less . This whole thread started as my calling out the original poster for essentially robbing the woman in question of her individuality and relegating her to some dismissable group , based on nothing but her race . The rest of what you 're talking about seems more like political talking points than anything we were discussing here . I 'm perfectly fine discussing all of those topics in their entirety . My problem is when you start using terms like `` we , '' `` they , '' `` you people , '' etc , which eliminates the possibility of having a rational discussion . I will say that most people prefer to discuss those things that directly influence them , so I get that you ( I 'm assuming here ) as a black person would prefer to discuss those topics , and white people would prefer to discuss things like affirmative action , and there are more whites , so those topics are discussed more , but I do n't know that there 's some effort exerted to not discuss the topics you listed . I will address some of those points separately if you like : Black poverty : There is pretty much unanimous agreement that blacks were not and current generations are not guilty for their current poverty . However , the disagreement comes from the direction of the current generation not overcoming that burden , as many other communities , in many other nations in similar ( it can never be exactly the same , of course ) or sometimes worse circumstances , have . The country has not become more racist in the past 40 years , and yet the conditions of inner city black families has stagnated if not grown worse ( single parenthood , teen pregnancy/abortion rates , crime rates , etc ) . Something needs to be done , people just disagree on what that thing is . Affirmative action : basing entry into schools upon race rather than socioeconomic status is asinine , and it 's the reason Harvard will likely lose the suit being filed against them by Asian americans who were discriminated against ( they were docked a full 200 points from their SAT 's due to acceptance quota 's ) based on nothing other than their race , and rightly so in my opinion . Should black persons be helped as much as possible ? Yes . At the expense of others and in many cases to the actual detriment of the blacks ? No . School Funding : I agree with you completely . Give us charter vouchers so we do n't get stuck going to a shit school just because of our zip code . Inner city politicians disagree . Economy : Everybody 's been hurt by the recessions and the shrinking of the middle class is an unavoidable consequence of cronyism within our economic system as it exists today ( Federal Reserve , collusion , subsidies , tarriffs , etc ) . Get rid of big government and let us do what South Korea , Hong Kong , and early Japan did when their economies were almost completely free of intervention .", "Michah Simmons 1 . Moving on 2 . Again moving on 3 . Trauma and breeding people can easily explain those things you mentioned . Go look up the studies on the off spring of those holocaust survivors . 4 . Like I said collective guilt for america or whites is fair if we are going to talk about the collective failures of my people . We can talk about black crime all day but never the failures of the drug war in terms of race . We can cry about affirmative action but you whites never want to talk about how schools are still racially divided and how inherited wealth and property taxs give white schools the upper hand . Yall love talking about black poverty but never the logistics of how 20 million people ( black population 60s ) were suppose to leave poverty collectively or in bulk in 50 years while industrial jobs were being shipped away , an economy with 3 recessions and a shrinking middle class where wages have n't grown at the same rate as expenses . Given all these hurdles your kind expects us to over come why ca n't you even handle 1 drug epidemic and a few trade deals . Imagine if we added a history of open exclusion from economic progress instead of generations of handouts you people would be ... .. whatever", "Just wanted to note I got a kick out of this conversation and wanted to say thanks for at least expending the energy to have it , even if you do think I 'm a white devil ( which is ironic as that was a term originally coined by my people ... ) : )", "Also , what difference does it make if I enslave you because you 're black , or because I just felt like it ? I 'm just as evil either way in that case , in my opinion . I do n't get the fixation on whether Africans saw themselves as black or not when they were enslaving each other . And of course if you 've only ever seen one other kind of person the thought that you could be a `` type '' of person ( race ) would never enter your mind . Once you saw the other type of person ( race ) , however , even a simpleton could come to the conclusion that the two are different . comment: As an atheist, this is pretty dumb. There are atheists who are just... stupid as hell, like myself; and there are religious people who are incredibly intelligent. Ones beliefs may be indicative of their intelligence, but one is not dependent on the other.
replies: ["@ miguel pedroso So , you agree - evolution of critters results in both new features and the loss of redundant featues as the environment changes . But I agree , there is a tendency towards complexity which while it brinds some problems , it also makes the critters more versatile and less affected by environmental & resource variablity . Remember , most life-forms are competing for limited resources . Trees , compete for sunlight , plants compete for water - animals compete for grazing areas , prey on which to feed and for mates to breed with * project their genes into the future . This competition will result in more complex organisms . Those that do n't evolve get out-competed for the essentials to stay alive & breed . _ '' if evolution is suppose to drive organisms to become better adapted , it has failed miserably . `` _ Evolution is not a choice and it has no 'intention ' - it is not 'supposed ' to do anything . It 's a description of what happens when competition exists . Every living thing today is the descendant of ancestors that survived and over time survival became a biological imperative . This is one reason why humans fight wars over limited resources - it 's animal survival instinct at play . I do n't see why you think mammalian reproductive systems are 'failing ' - the number of offspring produced has reached an equilibrium depending upon : the toll they take on the mother 's body during pregnancy , the investment of care & time needed to raise young , the number of individuals the environment can support and the proportion who will survive to sexual maturity , and so on . The human population on Earth has never been higher - and in fact is now at a toxic level - by virtue of the fact that using our intelliegence we have freed ourselved from a short life-expectancy and low child morbidity . Fundamentalist believers , who consider children are gifts from god and that to have a 'quiverful ' is a blessing are only making things worse .", "@ Leonard Ronald Dow the lack of organs because whatever evolutionary change can hardly point to a simplification of the organism . organism such as the whale may have lost legs , but they gained fins plus other structures to allow it to live in the sea . it is clear that organisms have gained over time complexity , a hugely damaging outcome of evolution . the reproductive system in mammals , if you rate it according to success in the number of offspring and the easiness to pass DNA , is worse that the one found in bacteria , for example . and why you judge ants ' behavior and decision making according to human way of thinking ? you see , there was no need for evolution to make bacteria , the ultimate survival machine into far less successful multicellular animals . if evolution is suppose to drive organisms to become better adapted , it has failed miserably .", "_ '' evolution ca n't explain why the reproductive system has gone worse '' _ in what way has 'the reproductive system ' got worse ? Evolution is that name we give to a change ( in allele frequency within a population ) over the generation . There is absolutely no reason why organisms will always be subject beneficial change when the environment around them ( natural or man-made ) changes ( I 'm thinking of chemical pollution and rapid climate fluctuations . ) Population bottleneck will often preserve an undesirable trait over a 'better ' trait that gets extinguished in an extinction event . Unnecessarily complex systems are as a result of unguided coping mechanisms proving useful/vital to survival - have you ever watched a line of ants go from A to B via a convoluted , inefficient route - simply because that 's the route the first 'scout ' ant followed searching for a food source . It demonstrates the LACK of Intelligent Design . Over the generations , simplification _may_ occur - if it 'costs ' a critter to grow an redundant organ - it is quite likely that any genetic error that results in that organ disappearing will be retained - for example - our Palmaris Longus muscle/tendon used to grip branches when swinging through the trees is no longer found in 12 % of the population . Vestigial organs _may_ be retained , even when the primary function has disappeared , if when it _was_ vital , it acquired some secondary function ( pelvic bones in a whale . ) _ '' To say that humans are at the top of the evolutionary chain '' _ who says that ? Nobody who knows anything about Evolution says that . The *only* way we are 'superior ' to any other animal - is that we have a few genetic mutations that have increased the 'power ' of our brains . In reality , we are all transitional life-forms in the 'latest ' position of our branch of the chain - not the 'top ' of anything ."]

comment: Richard should learn something from JESUS, if Jesus was so intellitent and He believed in God, why then people do not believe in God? Did they get stupid in their intelligence?
replies: ["@ Cris J _ '' I was referring to the origin of mankind . `` _ Yes , I know - I was just playing Nicodemus to your Jesus . Interesting that ! Matthews ' little misunderstanding only works in Greek - so Jesus must have been talking to Nicodemus in Greek . Who 'd have guessed ? You might say : _'Gift of life implies a giver of life ' _ - Yes , but it does n't say anything about that giver . Richard Dawkins speaks British English - the interviewer is British . In British colloquial English the word 'gift ' can imply *anything that you have n't had to pay for* , as in these other colloquially-used phrases : The sun *gives* us light and warmth . Plants *give* us oxygen . The food we eat and the oxygen in the air we breathe together *give* us energy . Our clothes *give* us protection from the elements . A falling apple gave Newton the idea about gravity . A snow-capped mountain range might *give* us an emotional feeling of awe and beauty . A dog will *give* its love/obedience to its owner . Hemorrhoids *give* you a pain in the ass . Boromir about the One Ring : _ '' It is a _*_gift . A gift_*_ to the foes of Mordor . Why not use this ring ? `` _ Need I go on ? And yes , I know that there are other words that could be used instead of 'give ' but that does n't invalidate my argument . The point is , *intelligence & intent are not necessary* for gifts to be given ( unless we are talking in a legal framework . ) I agree though that Dawkins does have a *gift* for using the wrong word at the wrong time ( there we go again ) . 'Science ' does n't ask *Why* ( or try to answer it ) because that would presuppose a *reason or purpose* exists and scientists ( should ) only be following the evidence - they make an observation and ask 'how did that come to be ? ' They do not assume there was a reason for it coming to be - only a *cause . * In the case of 'life ' - which should be seen ( scientifically ) only as a continuously repeating chemical process ( albeit extremely complex ) - the origin would be the random interaction between two or more compounds that kick-started a 'chain-reaction ' . Have a look at John Conway 's 'Life ' - just three simple rules and a random arrangement of 'elements ' can result in 'extinction ' or a 'survival ' of an on-going interaction . There is quite a good javascript implementation of it at pmav.eu - be sure to try the 'Gosper Glider Gun ' . There is no faith involved . People like Jack Szostak are working to discover plausible pathways from physics to chemistry to biology and new insights are being gained daily in trying to recreate the conditions under which the process began - *all by itself* . Believers do not have a monopoly on 'the numinous ' and it is unfortunate that the vocabulary that springs to mind , in such circumstances , is more frequently associated with religious experiences . There is no doubt about it though - Dawkins is no Sagan when it comes too doing the 'awe and wonder ' bit about Science - his words come over as too 'forced ' but hey , he 's a scientist not a poet .", 'I was referring to the origin of mankind . So is Dawkins basically saying that the universe is capable of giving a gift to us ? Also , science understands aspects of why we exist , but can not fully give us an answer.. Just like Christianity is limited by what the Scriptures say . Both requiring faith.. For being an atheist , he certainly uses lots of religious lingo.. especially at the end', "@ Christophe C You do n't know who are your parents ?"]
